Title: Front-End Developer Interview Course - Google Amazon Meta Apple Front-End Engineer Mock Interviews 2025 Update
Summary: Interview Kickstart, a leading platform for professional interview prep, has announced its updated Front-End Engineering course for 2025. The course aims to prepare front-end engineers for interviews at top tech companies, covering data structures, algorithms, JavaScript, UI/DOM, and front-end system design.

Title: The Best Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy With $2,000 Right Now
Summary: The article discusses two stocks from Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway portfolio that could be good investments amid market volatility: Amazon and American Express.

Title: PDD Holdings Stock Is Beaten Down Now, but It Could Rise Tenfold
Summary: PDD is a fast-growing Chinese e-commerce company that has expanded rapidly since its founding in 2015. It has focused on lower-tier cities, added more brand-name products, disrupted the grocery market, and launched an overseas marketplace. Analysts expect strong growth in the coming years, and the stock could potentially rise over 10-fold in the next decade if it maintains its momentum.

Title: Is Nu Holdings Stock a Millionaire Maker?
Summary: Nu Holdings, a financial services company in Brazil, has rapidly expanded its customer base and diversified into new verticals like digital payments and travel booking. The company reported record revenue and income in 2024, but its reliance on credit growth poses risks. Whether Nu Holdings can make investors millionaires depends on its ability to sustain rapid growth in the coming years.

Title: Meet the Spectacular Vanguard ETF With 43.2% of Its Portfolio Invested in Nvidia, Amazon, Apple, and Microsoft
Summary: The Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF holds a significant portion of its portfolio in Nvidia, Amazon, Apple, and Microsoft, which have been the driving force behind the S&P 500's impressive gains in recent years. The ETF has outperformed the S&P 500 over the long term, but it is highly concentrated in these tech giants, so it's important to maintain diversification in one's portfolio.

Title: Who Is Nvidia's Biggest Rival? Jensen Huang Offered a Clue, and You May be Surprised by the Answer.
Summary: Nvidia's biggest rival may be the company itself, as it rapidly innovates and introduces new chip architectures that outperform its previous models. This aggressive pace of innovation could potentially hurt sales growth if customers stick with older products, but Nvidia's large tech customers are likely to keep upgrading to the latest systems.
